Agent.description: The fundamental unit in Langroid representing an autonomous entity that can process and respond to messages
usage_examples:
from langroid import Agent
agent = Agent(name='my_agent', llm=llm_config, task='answer questions')

ChatAgent.description: A specialized agent for handling chat-based interactions
usage_examples:
from langroid import ChatAgent
chat_agent = ChatAgent(config=ChatAgentConfig(
    name='assistant',
    llm=llm_config
))

ToolAgent.description: An agent specialized for using tools and functions
usage_examples:
from langroid import ToolAgent
tool_agent = ToolAgent(tools=[MyTool], enable_llm=True)

Task.description: A unit of work that an agent can perform, including loop control and message handling
usage_examples:
from langroid import Task
task = Task(
    agent=agent,
    name='question_answering',
    system_message='Answer questions based on provided context.'
)

Tool.description: Functions that agents can use to interact with external systems or perform specialized operations

Conversation.description: Manages the flow of messages between agents
usage_examples:
from langroid import Conversation
conv = Conversation(task=task, max_turns=5)
result = conv.run()

common_user_intents.make agents talk to each other: Create multiple Agent instances and use a Conversation to manage message flow between them
common_user_intents.coordinate activities: Use Tasks to define specific activities for each agent and coordinate through message passing
common_user_intents.share information: Implement shared databases, message passing, or state management between agents
